title: What Is the Iran Nuclear Deal? What It Means, From Nuclear Weapons to the Price of Oil
sub_head: Western countries have growing concerns over Iran’s nuclear work, but recent weeks have seen negotiators get closer to a deal to limit it
body:
Iran, the U.S. and other world powers are nearing a deal to revive a 2015 agreement that curbs Tehran’s nuclear work in return for relief from international sanctions.
Russia recently made last-minute demands from the U.S. that its future economic ties with Iran after a nuclear deal wouldn’t be restricted by Western sanctions imposed on Moscow over Ukraine. This week, it softened those demands clearing the way for Tehran and Washington to try to complete a deal on restoring the 2015 deal.
